1.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to give, used with greatest latitude of application (put, make, etc.)
grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

2.brief: the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
to suck; causatively, to give milk
to set (literally or figuratively); intensively, to found; reflexively, to sit down together, i.e. settle, consult
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive
to repose, i.e. desist from exertion; used in many implied relations (causative, figurative or specific)
to grudge, i.e. avenge or punish

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
something to sieze with, i.e. a finger; by analogy, a toe
a star (as round or as shining); figuratively, a prince
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)

4.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
a man in general (singly or collectively)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.

5.brief: to lack; by implication, to fail, want, lessen
a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
to encircle (for attack or protection); especially to crown (literally or figuratively)

6.brief: an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to place (in a very wide application)
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda

7.brief: a family; also (from the sense of yoking or taming) an ox or cow
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)

8.brief: the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a well-trodden road (literally or figuratively); also a caravan

a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
